Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: ​​​​​​​​​​​​​​A vibrant and ambitious metropolis, Chicago is the central hub of the Midwest. Situated along Lake Michigan, it is the nation’s third-largest metropolitan area, home to an estimated 9.5 million people. Its central location, diverse economy, and a melting pot of cultures, position Chicago as one of the most influential cities around the globe. Long one of the world’s top job centers, its diverse economy, extensive transportation network, restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues has made the Chicago’s CBD a growth engine, attracting some of the largest international companies, such as Google, Facebook, Motorola, Dyson, and many more. In addition to a myriad of economic opportunities, Chicago boasts some of the most prestigious graduate schools, with The University of Chicago Booth School of Business and Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management having campuses downtown.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
CBRE is pleased to offer the fee simple sale of 65 E Wacker (“Property”), a 226,420 square foot (“SF”) Class B, CBD office building in Chicago’s Loop submarket, located on a 0.23-acre site. With its Art Deco styled lobby and masonry exterior, this offering presents a unique opportunity to acquire creative loft office space one block west of Michigan Avenue with exceptional views of the Chicago River.

The Property was built in 1928, the structure is reinforced concrete with a brick finish and rises 24 stories above street level. The improvements are nearly all office suites with retail (Morton’s Steakhouse) on the first and second floors. The basement level contains storage and mechanical space, while the third floor has a tenant fitness center and breakroom that was completely rennovated in 2018.

Being strategically positioned between North Wabash and Michigan Ave, the tenants have close access to two of the Chicago area’s busiest transit hubs: State/Lake, which provides several CTA lines service and served 3.8 million riders in 2019; and Millennium Station, which provides Metra commuter rail line service to the South Shore via the Metra Electric Line with 7.3 million passenger trips in 2019. In addition, the Property is only one-block away from the Chicago Water Taxi Stop on Michigan Avenue.

The smaller floor plates (approximately 10,000 sf) and six full floors that will be delivered vacant are amenable to the current demand for smaller, more flexible spaces. With approximately 60% in-place occupancy across a diverse tenancy and WALT of 4 years, the Property can be marked-to-market as in-place rents represent a 10.9% discount to market. As such, the Property presents a compelling investment opportunity to lease-up a creative loft office space and reap exceptional returns.

The Property’s DX-16 is the best designation in the city, allowing for a 520 foot non-residential or 440-foot residential tower. This offers a potentially great redevelopment opportunity in conjunction with the adjacent Hotel Monaco and Park One garage, which were put up for sale in 2018 but did not trade.

CBRE, Inc. is proud to be appointed as the exclusive sales advisor to offer qualified purchasers the opportunity to acquire 123 West Madison Street, Chicago, IL (“The Property”). The offering is comprised of a 22-story office building containing approximately 80,877 square feet of net rentable area. The building is situated on a rectangular 4,545-square foot parcel of land that is zoned DC-16, Downtown Core District. This offering provides the unique opportunity to purchase a 93%-leased, well maintained, multi-tenant office building located in the heart of the Central Loop submarket in Downtown Chicago.

The offering is comprised of Part 2 & 3 Story Buildings & Drive-thru 59,179 GSF of which 42,896 GSF is above grade. Improvements are located on a large 85,926 SF land site at the entrance of Lincoln Square's main retail corridor.

-Rare 2 acre development site in the heart of Lincoln square.
-Highly visible location.Site qualifies as a transit oriented development (TOD) as it is in proximity to the Western Brown Line CTA station.
-Potential of up to 343,704 of Buildable FAR if a TOD Development.
-Fifth Third will want to come back to new development with approximately 3,000 SF of corner space visibility with two drive-thru lanes and one ATM lane.
-Call for offers date will be announced.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Rare 2 Acre Development Site in Lincoln Square, Chicago
